title: RuntimeWarning: divide by zero encountered in float_scalars
body:
I'm getting this error very often when i train [SAEHD]
I used DFL version 2.0 on linux

============== Model Summary ===============
==                                        ==
==            Model name: new_SAEHD       ==
==                                        ==
==     Current iteration: 0               ==
==                                        ==
==------------ Model Options -------------==
==                                        ==
==            resolution: 256             ==
==             face_type: f               ==
==     models_opt_on_gpu: True            ==
==                 archi: dfhd            ==
==               ae_dims: 512             ==
==                e_dims: 128             ==
==                d_dims: 96              ==
==           d_mask_dims: 32              ==
==           use_float16: True            ==
==            learn_mask: True            ==
==            lr_dropout: False           ==
==           random_warp: True            ==
==             gan_power: 0.0             ==
==       true_face_power: 0.0             ==
==      face_style_power: 0.0             ==
==        bg_style_power: 0.0             ==
==               ct_mode: rct             ==
==              clipgrad: False           ==
==              pretrain: False           ==
==            autobackup: True            ==
== write_preview_history: False           ==
==           target_iter: 0               ==
==           random_flip: False           ==
==            batch_size: 30              ==
==                                        ==
==-------------- Running On --------------==

==                  Name: Quadro RTX 8000 ==
==                  VRAM: 47.46GB         ==

==                  Name: Quadro RTX 8000 ==
==                  VRAM: 47.46GB         ==
==                                        ==
============================================

Trying to do the first iteration. If an error occurs, reduce the model parameters.
